entry.string: Related documentation on Blocks
entry.translation: Relaterad dokumentation om Block

entry.string: Blocks Module - Xaraya Extension 13
entry.translation: Blockmodul - Xaraya tillägg 13

entry.string: official icon
entry.translation: officiell ikon

entry.string: What is it?
entry.translation: Vad är detta?

entry.string: The Blocks Module controls the configuration, display position and grouping of 'blocks' of content or functionality on your website. From version 1.1.2, the Blocks module also can control access and levels of accessto blocks. The Blocks module is a core module within Xaraya and cannot be removed.
entry.translation: Blockmodulen kontrollerar konfigurationen, visningspositionen och gruppering av 'block' med innehåll eller funktioner på din webbplats. Från version 1.1.2, kan även blockmodulen kontroller tillgång och åtkomstnivåer till block. Blockmodulen är en kärnmodul inom Xaraya och kan inte tas bort.

entry.string: How to use it?
entry.translation: Hur använder man den?

entry.string: Each module can provide a block type along with the code and templates for it. A block type defines a specific display of content or functionality that you can place on your site. For example the Articles module provides a 'featured article' block type, and a 'top items' block type. The Base module provides a 'menu' block type, among others.
entry.translation: Varje modul kan tillhandahålla en blocktyp tillsammans med kod och mallar för den. En blocktyp definierar en specifik visning av innehåll eller funktion som du kan placera på din webbplats. Till exempel tillhandahåller Artikel-modulen en 'aktuell artikel' blocktyp och en 'mest lästa' blocktyp. Basmodulen tillhandahåller bland annat ett 'meny'-block.

entry.string: These different block types are installed at the time of module installation, and removed when a module is uninstalled. The block types are also upgraded when a module is upgraded.
entry.translation: Dessa olika blocktyper installeras samtidigt som modulen, och tas bort när modulen avinstalleras. Blocktyperna uppdateras även när en modul uppdateras.

entry.string: The Blocks module enables you to work with Block Types to:
entry.translation: Blockmodulen tillåter dig att arbeta med Blocktyper för att:

entry.string: View Block Types:
entry.translation: Visa blocktyper:

entry.string: lists all the registered block types in your Xaraya installation with reference to which module they belong.
entry.translation: listar samtliga registrerade blocktyper i din Xaraya installation med referenser till vilka moduler de tillhör.

entry.string: Add a New Block Type:
entry.translation: Lägg till ny blocktyp:

entry.string: scans a module for a new block type. This option is added mainly for Developer convenience. Sometimes a developer provides a block type or upgrade of a block outside of a normal module release or upgrade. This option allows the block to be loaded and registered in your Xaraya installation. Normally you should never need to use this option in the process of administering your site.
entry.translation: skannar en modul för nya blocktyper. Detta alternativ är i huvudsak tillagt för utvecklare. Ibland tillhandahåller en utvecklare en blocktyp eller en uppdatering till ett block utanför en normal modulutgåva eller uppdatering. Detta alternativ tillåter blocket att laddas och registreras i din Xaraya installation. Normalt ska du aldrig behöva använda det här alternativet i administrationsprocessen för din webbplats.

entry.string: Using Blocks and Block Groups
entry.translation: Använda block och blockgrupper

entry.string: There are a number of steps required to create a new block of content or functionality for your site, and display it:
entry.translation: Det är ett antal nödvändiga steg för att skapa ett nytt innehållsblock eller funktion för din webbplats och visa det:

entry.string: Create a new block instance based on any of your installed block types
entry.translation: Skapa nya blockinstanser baserat på dina installerade blocktyper

entry.string: Assign the block instance to an existing block group during block creation or modification (optional)
entry.translation: Tilldela blockinstansen till en befintligt blockgrupp under blockskapning eller modifiering (valfritt)

entry.string: If you need a new block group, create one and then assign the block instance to it
entry.translation: Om du behöver en ny blockgrupp, skapa en och tilldela sedan blockinstansen till den

entry.string: Add a blockgroup tag in your theme template so Xaraya knows where to display your blocks. eg <xar:blockgroup name="right" id="right" />.

Xaraya has pre-configured block groups created at installation time that include right, left, center, topnav and header block groups. Special block group tags are used in the default Xaraya theme to place and display them and the block instances already assigned to them. In the case of the default block groups their name reflects the position where they are located in the default theme. You can rename these block groups as the names are not significant in themselves

Note: you do not have to allocated a block instance to a blockgroup. You can place the block instance display directly into your theme templates using a block tag. Please check RFC0010 for details on using this tag.
Creating and Viewing Block Groups
The Blocks module provides a number of options to work with Block Goups:
View Block Groups:
displays all the defined Block Groups on your site with links to Edit or Delete options
Add Block Group:
option presents a simple input screen so you can add a new block group
Creating, Viewing and Modifying Block Instances
Creating and modifying block instances with Xaraya is simple:
View Block Instances:
displays all current block instances that are available for use in your Xaraya site. From this menu option you can modify or delete any of the listed block instances.
Add New Block Instance:

Create and make available a new block instance for display on your site. As part of this process you may nominate which block type to use for creation of the block instance, and optionally assign the block instance to a Block Group.
Modify a Block Instance:

from the View Block Instance listing provides the option to allocate the block instance to one or more Block Groups. In addition, you can optionally specify whether the block instances should use an override block instance (inner) template or block group (outer) template (see Templating Blocks and Block Groups). Each module also specifies any special content here that is available for configuration for this specific block type.
Templating Blocks and Block Groups
As with other Xaraya content, you can provide your own override templates for block instances and create your own templates for block groups. To do this note the following:

Inner template is used for display of the content in a block instance and supplied by the module that provides the block type. They can be overridden like any other Xaraya template. Overrides for for block instance inner templates should be be placed in themes/[yourtheme]/modules/[themodule]/blocks where [themodule] is the module providing the block type. The general name for the template is blocktype-innertemplatename.xt

Outer template is the name given to the template used for the block instance's block group. Some 'outer' templates are installed by default with Xaraya, but you can also create your own 'outer' templates. The outer templates are stored in your theme/[yourtheme]/blocks directory. If there is no specific block group template the block group will use the preinstalled 'default' block group template.
How to tell Xaraya which inner and outer templates to use

You can tell Xaraya which inner and outer templates to use when you create a new block instance or modify an existing one. Using the Blocks module, there are two places you can set either the inner template, the outer template or both.

The field labelled Instance Template (optional): sets the default inner and outer template used for the block instance and any block group. You can specify inner, outer, both inner and outer or none. You use the following format: [outer-template][semi-colon][inner-template]. Both are specified without the file extension.

If you add a block instance to a block group, another input field will appear, labelled with the name of the block group. You can also add a specific inner, outer or both inner and outer template in this field using the same syntax. Specifying an inner or outer template in this block group template field will override any other templates.
An example: if you create an articles' featureditems block instance and you are using the Xaraya_Classic default theme
By default, this block instance will use the article module's inner template called featureditems.xd located in modules/articles/xartemplates/blocks

If you have allocated the featured article block instance to a block group called 'right' it will use, by default, the outer template located at themes/Xaraya_Classic/blocks/right.xt. If the 'right' outer template did not exist it will use one called 'default.xt' in that same directory.

If you wish to override both outer and inner templates for the featureditems block then the syntax example of: left;weeklyfeature would mean means the outer template is one created and called left.xt in the themes/Xaraya_Classic/blocks directory. The article module's featureditems block instance will be displayed using the themes/Xaraya_Classic/modules/articles/blocks/featureditems-weeklyfeature.xt template. You could just specify outer or inner template if required by adding left; or ;weeklyfeature to specify outer and inner respectively.
Included Blocks
entry.translation: Medföljande block

entry.string: The Blocks Module has no blocks included at this time.
entry.translation: Blockmodulen har för tillfället inga medföljande block.

entry.string: Included Hooks
entry.translation: Medföljande kopplingar

entry.string: The Blocks Module has no hooks included at this time.
entry.translation: Blockmodulen har för tillfället inga medföljande kopplingar.

entry.string: Further Information
entry.translation: Ytterligare information

entry.string: Further information on the Blocks module can be found at
entry.translation: Ytterligare information om blockmodulen finns på

entry.string: Blocks Module Extension page at Xaraya Extension and Releases. Click on Version History tab at the bottom to get the latest release information.
Related tutorials and documentation on Blocks found at Xaraya Documentation.
